page.title: 11THE FARMER, WEST BURTON
page.content: Douglas's farm is on the edge of West Burton. He has 230 acres of grass land and rough grazing. The farm has a dairy herd of 42 Friesian cows with 40 followers (young stock which will join the herd later) and 250 ewes to lamb half-bred lambs. The lambs are fattened and in September/October they are sold and go down country for better grazing. The milk goes to Hawes creamery. It is collected by bulk tanker. When the cows are old they go to market to be sold for beef. Bull calves are sold at three weeks. Douglas now has a son helping him so that he is able to go on holiday with his wife in October each year. Douglas has 2 sheepdogs which he trains himself. They help with the cows and sheep. He also keeps some hens. Douglas is on the local Parish Council and is very keen on cricket.
